document.docAuthor: Dellacasa, Marco, Dellacasa, Giovanni & Arriaga-Jiménez, Alfonsina
document.masterDocTitle: Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Aphodiinae), a new species from Oaxaca, Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Aphodiinae), a new species from Oaxaca, Mexico

heading.emphasis:
Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis Dellacasa, Dellacasa
, & Arriaga-Jiménez, new species ( Figs. 1–9 )

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality. Zempoaltépetl, Municipio Santa María Tlahuitoltepec, 17.10567°N , 96.00120°W , 2583 m , Oaxaca , Mexico .

materialsCitation.stateProvince: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype repository.
Instituto de Ecología , Xalapa , Veracruz , Mexico .

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Length 4.5–5.0 mm ( holotype length: 4.5 mm ); oval elongate, moderately convex, rather shiny, glabrous. Dorsal surface chestnut brown, head anteriorly and sides of pronotum paler; elytra chestnut brown with base of interstriae 2–4 and 6–10 as well as apex yellowish brown; apical declivity including an oblique, oval, yellow spot extended from interstria 2–7 and with margins dark ( Fig. 5 , holotype , allotype and most of the specimens of type series), sometimes the margins widely faded ( Figs. 6–7 ); scutellum yellowish brown with margins darker; legs brown; antennal club dark brown; underside dark brown.

Pronotum transverse, moderately convex, simply, densely punctate, with elongate mediobasal area more-or-less impunctate; lateral margins strongly inwardly sinuate before hind angles, thickly bordered, edge with indistinct short cilia; hind angles obliquely truncate; base slightly bisinuate, not bordered.
Scutellum small, triangularly elongate; sparsely, superficially punctate.

Elytra oval-elongate, denticulate at shoulder, finely striate; striae deep, fine, punctate, subcrenulate; interstriae almost flat, distinctly not closely punctate, superficially microreticulate, the second interstria slightly wider than the others.

Protibiae distally tridentate and proximally serrulate on outer margin; upper surface densely and more-or-less coarsely punctate. Metatibiae with feeble transverse carinae on outer face, apically fimbriate with spinules elongate and irregularly unequal; upper spur shorter than metatarsomere 1; metatarsomere 1 longer than metatarsomeres 2–4 combined.

Sexual dimorphism . Male: protibiae relatively slender, pronotum more transverse, metasternal plate with median longitudinal groove deep. Female: protibiae relatively stouter, pronotum less transverse, metasternal plate with median longitudinal groove more superficial.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Named after the type locality.

Bionomics. Specimens of the type series were collected from the end of May until September. In San Pablo Etla
G. zempoaltepetlensis
was collected together with
Agrilinellus azteca (Harold, 1863)
( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Aphodiinae : Aphodiini ),
Onthophagus zapotecus Zunino & Halffter, 1988
,
O. chevrolati Bates, 1889
( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Scarabaeinae : Onthophagini ), and
Canthidium quercetorum Kohlmann, Arriaga-Jiménez
, & Rös, 2018 ( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Scarabaeinae : Ateuchini ).

In San Esteban Atatlauca (Mixteca region of Oaxaca ),
G. zempoaltepetlensis
was found in pitfall traps baited with human excrement, but also in traps baited with regional fungus, together with
Pseudogonaphodiellus zdzislawae Dellacasa, Dellacasa
, & Gordon, 2007 ( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Aphodiinae : Aphodiini ),
Oscarinus indutilis Harold, 1874
( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Aphodiinae : Aphodiini ),
Blackburneus guatemalensis (Bates, 1887)
( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Aphodiinae : Aphodiini ), and
Onthophagus howdenorum Zunino & Halffter, 1988
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9. Habitus of
Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis
(paratype, Zempoaltépetl, Municipio Santa María Tlahuitoltepec, 17°06'10.32"N, 96°00'03.72"W, 2676 m, Oaxaca, Mexico). Photograph by A. Ballerio.

FIGURE 10. Map showing the known distribution of
Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis
. From left to right, Cerro del Aguila (Mixteca), La Peña de San Felipe and Zempoaltépetl (Sierra Norte), and to the south Miahuatlán (Sierra Sur).

subSubSection.paragraph:
In San José del Pacifico,
G. zempoaltepetlensis
was collected together with
Agrilinellus azteca
and
Pseudogonaphodiellus zdzislawae
. While in San Sebastían Rio Hondo
G. zempoaltepetlensis
was collected only with
Agrilinellus azteca
. Both sites are part of the Sierra Sur of Oaxaca .

In Zempoaltépetl,
G. zempoaltepetlensis
was collected together with
Agrilinellus azteca
,
Gonaphodiellus bimaculosus (Schmidt, 1909)
,
Gonaphodiellus opisthius (Bates, 1887)
,
Oscarinus indutilis (Harold, 1874)
,
Onthophagus chevrolati
,
O. undulans oaxacanus Zunino & Halffter, 1988
,
O. subcancer Howden, 1973
,
Onthotrupes viridiobscurus (Jekel, 1865)
( Geotrupidae : Geotrupinae : Geotrupini ), and
Ontherus mexicanus Harold, 1868
( Coleoptera : Scarabaeidae : Scarabaeinae : Dichotomiini).

Discussion.
Gonaphodioides zempoaltepetlensis
is similar to
G. ratcliffei ,
but can be distinguished from that species mainly by the lateral margin of the pronotum strongly inwardly sinuate before hind angles and by the finer punctation of the interstriae.
